messages.subject: Re: Music in Japan
messages.msgSnippet: Well.... I have some manga and tokusatsu related music in mp3 format at my hard drive, however, with the exception of the Tenchi In Love II music theme,
messages.messageBody:
Well.... I have some manga and tokusatsu related music in mp3 format at my
hard drive, however, with the exception of the Tenchi In Love II music
theme, tokusatsu music from people like Akira Kushida, I doubt you will find
it "very relaxing" he he he

Anyway, if you use yahoo messenger and we meet online, perhaps I can send
some files to you. But I am at Brazil Timezone, and perhaps it will be a
little difficult to happen.

Regards

Octavio Augusto Okimoto Alves de Carvalho
São Paulo - SP Brazil

>very much.It's very relaxing.

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Music in Japan
messages.msgSnippet: Ok,thanks.But if I can find some old Japanese music,maybe,from the Sengoku period. I found a melody in the Grolier 2000 Encyclopedia that s like Old McDonald
messages.messageBody:
Ok,thanks.But if I can find some old Japanese music,maybe,from the Sengoku period.
I found a melody in the Grolier 2000 Encyclopedia that's like "Old McDonald had a farm" and it's a very beautiful song.Everytime I listened to it I nearly fallen asleep.It's very slow and makes you fall asleep.

Edy

Nate Ledbetter <ltdomer98@...> wrote:
Yeah, Japanese music is very relaxing...

I suggest you try the group "Judy and Mary" for some
nice, relaxing Japanese music...or maybe "Glay"...

LOL

Okay, a SERIOUS suggestion--if you use Kazaa or
another P2P, just try looking some up. Should be easy
to find, though you may end up with the greatest (?)
hits of Shonen Knife..

Nate
